title: Coverage Set for NASA’s Boeing OFT-2 Briefings, Events, Broadcast
summary: NASA will provide coverage of the upcoming prelaunch, launch, and docking activities for the agency’s Boeing Orbital Flight Test-2 (OFT-2) to the International Space Station.

title: SES mulls direct-to-handheld 5G satellite business
summary: SES is considering plans to provide 5G services directly to handheld devices after rescuing spectrum rights for 62 proposed satellites that were about to expire.

title: NOAA reveals first images from new weather satellite
summary: NOAA released the first imagery from the new GOES-18 weather satellite that launched March 1 from Cape Canaveral, and confirmed the spacecraft’s main camera doesn’t suffer the same cooling system problem that caused degraded vision in an earlier satellite.

title: Manchin introduces bipartisan bill to establish Space National Guard
summary: Senator Joe Manchin (D-WV) on May 12 introduced legislation to create a National Guard for the U.S. Space Force.

title: Astronomers unveil first image of the Milky Way’s central black hole
summary: Three years after capturing the first image of a supermassive black hole in a galaxy 55 million light years away, astronomers have managed to “photograph” the gaping maw of the smaller but much closer black hole quietly lurking at the core of the Milky Way, researchers announced Thursday.

title: Colorado Students to Hear from Astronauts Aboard Space Station
summary: Students from Boulder, Colorado, will have an opportunity next week to hear from American and European astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

title: Boeing considering redesign of Starliner valves
summary: Boeing says it is considering redesigning the propellant valves on future CST-100 Starliner commercial crew spacecraft as a long-term solution to the corrosion problem those valves suffered last year.

title: Melting Arctic ice opens new front in strategic power competition
summary: Warming seas and thinning polar ice caps promise to turn the Arctic into a hub of greater economic activity — and a new hotspot for military competition.

title: SpaceX ready to begin training astronauts for first private spacewalk
summary: Two members of the “Polaris Program” say that SpaceX could begin training private astronauts for the first private spacewalk in spaceflight history...

title: Astra reveals details of next, larger rocket
summary: Astra disclosed details about its new launch vehicle that will be capable of carrying heavier payloads and flying more frequently.
